revised_title: Electrical Control of Flame Carbon: Effects of Electric Fields on Carbon Formation and Deposition
tldr: This study investigates the electrical characteristics of carbon formation and deposition in a flat counterflow diffusion flame with applied electric fields. The authors found that particles are charged by electron emission and attachment, and that electric fields can induce various effects on carbon nucleation, growth, and deposition. The results have practical applications in controlling carbon formation and improving flame properties.
